{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3001674,"name":"Carl Guo","username":"carlguo866","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/carlguo866/{size}/164426_2.png","created_at":"2022-02-02T02:14:29.013Z","cooked":"

In past years, we have used a ratchet for our climbing winch since the winch and the hook extension are powered by two different motors. This year, we decided to switch to a telescoping arm extended out with constant force springs and retracted back with a winch. This new design, and the possibility of releasing the hook to get to the high rung or traversal rung, means that we can no longer use a ratcheting system. Does solely depending on the brake mode on a motor like NEO work to prevent the arm from re-extending and the robot drifting down? Or there should be certain extra mechanisms to hold the arm in place?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2022-02-02T02:14:29.013Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":92,"reads":252,"readers_count":251,"score":525.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":401975,"topic_slug":"preventing-telescoping-arm-from-re-extending","display_username":"Carl Guo","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38968,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FRC 3566 üé£"},"post_url":"/t/preventing-telescoping-arm-from-re-extending/401975/1","custom_user_title":"FRC 3566 üé£","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3001697,"name":"ASmith1675","username":"ASmith1675","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asmith1675/{size}/3328_2.png","created_at":"2022-02-02T02:31:50.242Z","cooked":"

A solution we‚Äôve used (including this year) is to use a 2 speed gearbox for the climber. We have ratchet connected to the low speed side, and we don‚Äôt gear the high speed side to create a ‚Äúneutral‚Äù.

We use the ratchet to keep the climber in stowed position for the match, shift to neutral to deploy the climber, then shift back to re-engage the ratchet. We like this system compared to some other ratcheting solutions because it gives us the opportunity to try again if we miss our hook for some reason.

Obviously a lot of this would depend on packaging requirements.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2022-02-02T02:31:50.242Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":237,"readers_count":236,"score":107.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":401975,"topic_slug":"preventing-telescoping-arm-from-re-extending","display_username":"ASmith1675","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9669,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"I don't know what that building is, but I want to build robots there."},"post_url":"/t/preventing-telescoping-arm-from-re-extending/401975/2","custom_user_title":"I don't know what that building is, but I want to build robots there.","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3001700,"name":"Skye Leake","username":"Skyehawk","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png","created_at":"2022-02-02T02:34:49.330Z","cooked":"

For those considering this setup:
You have to make sure the inner rope is exactly the right length with this setup. Don‚Äôt want the telescoping sections to literally launch out of the robot when you shift to neutral.

Reminds me of 2018 when more than a few teams launched their elevator sections out of the robot‚Ä¶

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2022-02-02T02:35:07.117Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":217,"readers_count":216,"score":78.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":401975,"topic_slug":"preventing-telescoping-arm-from-re-extending","display_username":"Skye Leake","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":9669,"username":"ASmith1675","name":"ASmith1675","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asmith1675/{size}/3328_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":19235,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Pretengineer"},"post_url":"/t/preventing-telescoping-arm-from-re-extending/401975/3","custom_user_title":"Pretengineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3001711,"name":"ASmith1675","username":"ASmith1675","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/asmith1675/{size}/3328_2.png","created_at":"2022-02-02T02:48:45.781Z","cooked":"

Hard stop or secondary rope to act as a hard stop are also effective.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2022-02-02T02:48:45.781Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":188,"readers_count":187,"score":77.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":401975,"topic_slug":"preventing-telescoping-arm-from-re-extending","display_username":"ASmith1675","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":19235,"username":"Skyehawk","name":"Skye Leake","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/skyehawk/{size}/179363_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9669,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"I don't know what that building is, but I want to build robots there."},"post_url":"/t/preventing-telescoping-arm-from-re-extending/401975/4","custom_user_title":"I don't know what that building is, but I want to build robots there.","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2},{"id":"100","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3001715,"name":"Stewart Riley","username":"Strategic","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/strategic/{size}/10157_2.png","created_at":"2022-02-02T02:52:55.505Z","cooked":"

If you‚Äôre using these to climb to the high or traverse bars, then it‚Äôs as simple as setting the rope length to allow no more than the maximum extension you want from the arm(s). Then it really doesn‚Äôt matter if the arm extends to maximum once you‚Äôre on the higher bars, since you‚Äôll also still be off the floor even at maximum extension. It‚Äôs the one thing about this year‚Äôs high point value climbs that actually allows you to simplify the mechanism.

Using a ratcheting gearbox on an arm is nice but the problem with it is if your driver, for whatever reason, goes too far, you can‚Äôt go backwards. One way is to power the arm independently from the string/rope, then put the rope on its own ratcheting motor. This way they can go backwards if they make an error and the ratchet will still keep the bot in place (assuming the rope is strong enough).

Mason1802:

but the problem with it is if your driver, for whatever reason, goes too far, you can‚Äôt go backwards

That‚Äôs not a problem if you have a system in place to actuate the ratchet!
